data.title: Hidden gem
data.text: We found this place by luck. It's located in a old strip mall. Limited tables inside most people were getting take out. Very nice large menu with something for everyone. They also have some combo dishes all under 8.50. Food was hot and fresh and made it order with specific requests done right. They accept credit cards (except Amex) only complaint is poor ventilation in the resturant and not sure if they have AC or if it wasn't working when we came. We would go back!

data.title: A Great Takeout Place if You Like Spicy Asian Food!
data.text:
If you like spicy Asian food that is affordable like I do, then this is a great place to patronize!  I had the Mogolian Spicy Chicken and it was really good!  The prices are very reasonable.  Another thing I liked about this place is the menu had a wide variety of choices not found at your typical run of the mill Chinese takeout.  

The only criticism I have is that Spring Rolls (non-fried) could use a few more shrimp.  Other then that, I look forward to coming back for more!

data.title: Great Local Asian
data.text: My favorite local Asian place.  Good service great food.  Have eaten here many times and have never been disappoined.  :)

data.title: High Quality Chinese Restaurant
data.text: Angkor Restaurant has a wide assortment of chinese cuisine at low prices.  Every time I have gone here, my food comes within 5-10 minutes. The server could be a little more attentive, but otherwise I had a great experience.

data.title: Horrible Customer Appreciation
data.text: I had been ordering from them for some time then they didn't get my delivery right and when I called on it they refused to bring it back out to me and told me to come get it myself. I'll never order from them again! How rude!! I was talking to the owner too. Pathetic for a business man.

data.title: Good Asian Food
data.text: Daughter and I tried Angkor. It was a cold night, so the windows were very steamy. Plus the place could use better ventilation because the heat and smells from the kitchen overwhelm the restaurant. It is in a hole in the wall old strip mall. But don't let the looks deceive you. You can see the kitchen from the front room and it is clean. Angkor has the best Asian food in the area. We had the cream cheese wontons which were crunchy, sweet, and cheesy - the perfect blend. We followed this up with their pork egg rolls. Now the egg rolls are not typical cabbage filled Chinese egg rolls. The place is Cambodian after all. The Cambodian egg rolls lean towards Vietnamese style egg rolls. Angkor's pork egg rolls were so much better than typical fare. For entree's we chose beef lo mien, sesame chicken and house fried rice. The beef lo mien was better than the other lo mien offered by other places in the area. The noodles were very delicate. The sesame chicken was good but not great. Next time I'll try the General Tsao chicken or another alternate. The house fried rice was outstanding. It was filled with various meats. They do not skimp on the protein. They had shrimp, bbq pork, chicken, etc. in the rice along with a lot of egg which I like. It was the best fried rice I have had in a long time. Also remember when your order totals more than $20, they will give you either free pop, egg rolls, or won tons. The delivery charge is $2. I think I will take advantage of that next time. Give this place a try because we need to keep places like this in Coon Rapids.

data.title: Great Food
data.text: This is gonna be my new favorite place...I order chicken mushroom chow main and Mongolian spicy chicken & Chicken Fried Rice. I think I like Chicken...lol  I ordered over $20 worth of food and they gave me a free 2 liter of pop. The service was great and the was food was fantastic.

data.title: Best in town
data.text: Outstanding. Eaten there many times. Tried many different items. All of them excellent. Best Asian in Coon Rapids/Blaine area. Nice bonus is order more than $20 and get a free item. Always look forward to my next order!

data.title: Great deals and combos and good quality food delivery
data.text: I didn't feel like going out so I ordered the delivery service. A polite young lady answered the phone and took my order and even offered me a free bottle of soda or appetizer because my order was over 20$ the gen Taos chicken is amazing. But my favorite part was the cream cheese wontons. They were nice and sweet and tasty. All the food was delivered quickly and by a very polite gentleman. The gyozas are also delish. I would recommend this as a quality local delivery service to anyone.
